H0.text: What was abolished by the Supreme Court in 1972, but reinstated in 1976. Capital Punishment

H1.text: What was abolished by the Supreme Court in 1972, but reinstated in 1976. Mandatory Minimum Sentences

H2.text: What was abolished by the Supreme Court in 1972, but reinstated in 1976. Corporal Punishment

H3.text: What was abolished by the Supreme Court in 1972, but reinstated in 1976. Execute

A4.text: In 1972, the Supreme Court of the United States struck down capital punishment statutes in Furman v. Georgia, reducing all pending death sentences to life imprisonment.

A5.text: In 1976, the Supreme Court affirmed the legality of the death penalty in the 1976 case Gregg v. Georgia.
